name: Business Leadership Endeavor III
long_desc: Business Leadership Endeavor BLE is a required 3mini course sequence offered to undergraduate business students. BLE 70305 is the third mini of the BLE course sequence. BLE introduces students to their leadership journey via four development frameworks student development, personal development, professional development, and community development. BLE 70305 will continue to build strong personal and professional skills as students get closer to their professional endeavors. Students will be applying learned skills in and out of the classroom and will begin to see the how the assembled skills are beneficial to themselves and others. This course will emphasize the importance of continued broad growth and lifelong learning.

custom_fields.goals: In this course, students will learn and apply the Big Five Accelerators Selling Your Product, Grit and Emotional Intelligence, Leadership, Networks and Power, Looking Ahead for whole person development via class discussions, reflection, and group project.
custom_fields.key_topics: student development, personal development, professional development, community development.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students should have completed and applied skills learnt in Business Leadership Endeavor I and II.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Class participation, in- class exercises, short write-ups and group project.
custom_fields.relevance: This course is for Tepper Business School majors. It will explore a variety of personal and professional skills essential for success in the classroom, at work, and in life.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Canvas site, readings, cases, short topic memos.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Group project, short write-ups and meetings with mentors.
